head.title: Sept. 24-30; Defense of Wen Ho Lee Case

hedline.hl1: Sept. 24-30; Defense of Wen Ho Lee Case

block.p: After weeks of criticism, Attorney General Janet Reno and Louis J. Freeh, director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, admitted at a Senate hearing that the government had made mistakes in its handling of the case against the nuclear scientist Wen Ho Lee. But they expressed no regret for the criminal prosecution of Dr. Lee, which collapsed earlier this month when Mr. Lee pleaded guilty to a single count of mishandling atomic secrets. As Ms. Reno put it, ''Dr. Lee is no hero.''
